Sentence.sentence: Why should you consider taking a course in demography in college? You’ll be growing up in a generation where the baby boomers are going into retirement and dying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Mothers have been warned for years that sleeping with their newborn infant is a bad idea, because it increases the risk that the baby might die unexpectedly during the night.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even apart from the increased competition, the kids enter a process that has been utterly transformed from the one baby boomers knew.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Not only is the competition getting more intense, the application process today is also totally different from what baby boomers knew
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Hopefulness fueled America's baby boom.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What accounted for America's baby boom
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many physicists say the next Einstein hasn't been born yet, or is a baby now.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And since she wants to go back to work, I've decided to take a year off to raise the baby.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He will stop work to take care of the baby
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: His wife is going to give birth to a baby.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The baby watches a sort of show on a small stage.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Baby boys do not react at all to the difference and the size of the cube
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Already it is known that bones, muscles and nerves develop faster in baby girls.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Baby girls usually talk at an earlier age than boys do
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Access to foot traffic and proximity to transit allow the type of entertainment-oriented businesses such as bars and restaurants to stay open later, which attracts both younger, creative workers and baby boomers nearing retirement alike.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Bria Dunham, a mother in Somerville, Massachusetts, was so excited to watch a moment of brotherly bonding while her first-grader and baby took a bath together that she snapped a few photos.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The Israeli study suggests that doing so may be best for the baby, but may take a toll on mom.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: When the water hits the right level, the baby birds are kept safe from predators by a corrosive ditch.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"孩子"之意。
means: baby ： 日常用词，一般指从刚出生的婴儿到满两岁的或非常小的孩子，常含钟爱意味。
child ： 普通用词，含义广，无感情色彩。泛指从胎儿、婴儿到10岁左右的儿童。
infant ： 书面用词，狭义指出生后到两岁的小孩，广义指7岁以下的孩子；法律上则指未到法定年龄。
youngster ： 泛指任何年龄的儿童或者少年，多指男孩，多为年长者的使用。

list.explanation: 嗜酒者，酒鬼，酒精中毒病人

example.en: The bottle babies sat there, waiting to be thrown out at closing time.
example.zh: 那些酒鬼坐在那里，等候酒馆打烊下逐客令。

example.en: There is help for bottle babies.
example.zh: 有治疗酒精屮毒病人的办法。

list.explanation: 蛮不讲理的人，无法无天者

example.en: Don't be such a tough baby. Who do you think you are?
example.zh: 别这样无法无天, 你以为你是谁啊？

word_mean: 婴儿：尚不能行走的小孩

Sentence.sentence: A scientist working at her lab bench and a six-old baby playing with his food might seem to have little in common.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: And the more frequently mothers had called to their eggs, the more similar were the babies' begging calls.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Babies are born with the knowledge of object support.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Babies need a lot of rest: most of them sleep about 18 hours a day! adults need about eight hours.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Before birth, babies can tell the difference between loud sounds and voices.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Chinese scientists recently had a chance to study a wild female panda with a newborn baby.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Embryonic learning helps mother birds to identify the baby birds which fit the environment better.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 题设

Sentence.sentence: He finds that if babies aged 18 months see an unrelated adult with hands full trying to open a door, almost all will immediately try to help.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Her mother Maxime, one of a family of fourteen, had been an athlete herself as a young girl but, like so many other girls in Waterhouse, had to stop after she had her first baby.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: In addition, the team set up a separate experiment that suggested that the baby birds that most closely imitated their mom's voice were rewarded with the most food.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In China, when a baby is one month old, families name and welcome their child in a celebration that includes giving red-colored eggs to guests.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: Instead, babies may form an understanding of object support through repeated experiments and then build on this knowledge to learn even more about how objects interact.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: It is likely that babies are not born knowing the basic fact of the universe; nor are they ever clearly taught it.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: It turns out that baby red-backed fairy wrens also emerge chirping like their moms.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: It was time for her to have a new baby, and it was also time for the young panda to be independent.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Much to the family's surprise, Dennis stuck to his promise! He turned up at the hospital bearing gifts for the new mother lindsey and her baby boy.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: On march 19, Dennis got a group text informing him that a couple he didn't know were at the hospital, waiting for the arrival of a baby.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps evolution provided human babies with curiosity and a natural drive to explain their worlds, and adult scientists simply make use of the same drive that served them as children.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Scientific research into babies games is possible.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Scientists and babies often interact with each other.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Scientists and babies seem to observe the world differently.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: She licked the baby constantly to keep it clean.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Studying babies' play may lead to a better understanding of science.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Take a closer look at the baby playing at the table.

Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 语法填空 原文

Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The mother held the baby in her front paws much the way a human does.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The nature of babies' play has been thoroughly investigated.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: The purpose of a pony drift is to gather them up so their health can be checked, the baby ones can be stooped from feeding on their mother's milk, and those who've gone beyond their limited area can be returned to their correct area.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This enabled Emma to give birth to five baby cranes.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: This is called "herd immunity", which protects the people who get hurt easily, including those who can't be vaccinated for medical reasons, babies too young to get vaccinated and people on whom the vaccine doesn't work.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: When the eggs were hatched, the baby birds made the similar chirp to their mothers—a sound that served as their regular "Feed me!" call.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: You can even listen through the headset only and put the TV on mute if the situation calls for a quiet environment —maybe the baby is sleeping.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Unhappy parents rarely are provoked to wonder if they shouldn’t have had kids, but unhappy childless folks are bothered with the message that children are the single most important thing in the world: obviously their misery must be a direct result of the gaping baby-size holes in their lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The magazine cover showing an attractive mother holding a cute baby is hardly the only Madonna-and-child image on newsstands this week.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It’s hard to imagine that many people are dumb enough to want children just because Reese and Angelina make it look so glamorous: most adults understand that a baby is not a haircut.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It's hard to imagine that many people are dumb enough to want children just because Reese and Angelina make it look so glamorous: most adults understand that a baby is not a haircut.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: Don't be a baby and cry over that little scratch.
sentences.cn: 别那么孩子气, 擦破点皮就哭个不停。

sentences.en: Where's the baby which needs injection?
sentences.cn: 需要打针的婴儿在哪里?

means.word_mean: （家庭或团体中）最年幼的成员

把…当作婴孩看待, 娇养</seg>

phrase.cizu_name: throw the baby out (或 away) with the bathwater

jx.jx_en_mean: discard something valuable along with other things that are inessential or undesirable
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把洗澡水连同孩子一起倒掉，丢弃糟粕精华也扔了

entry.def: A baby is a very young child, especially one that cannot yet walk or talk.

example.ex: She used to take care of me when I was a baby...
example.tran: 我还在襁褓中时，她曾经照顾过我。

example.ex: My wife has just had a baby...

entry.def: A baby animal is a very young animal.
Baby vegetables are vegetables picked when they are very small.
Some people use baby as an affectionate way of addressing someone, especially a young woman, or referring to them.
entry.tran: 宝贝儿（昵称，尤用于年轻女性）

example.ex: You have to wake up now, baby...

entry.def: If you throw the baby out with the bath water, you lose the good parts of something as well as the bad parts, because you reject it as a whole instead of just removing what is bad.
entry.tran: 把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉；将精华连同糟粕一起丢弃；不分好坏地全盘抛弃

entry.def: If you are left holding the baby, you are put in a situation where you are responsible for something, often in an unfair way because other people fail or refuse to take responsibility for it.
entry.tran: 替他人擦屁股；替别人干苦差事

example.ex: You go off round the world, and leave me to hold the baby.
example.tran: 你满世界地跑，把苦差事都扔给我。

means.word_mean: 1. a very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk;

sentences.sentence: "isn't she too young to have a baby?"

means.word_mean: 2. sometimes used as a term of address for attractive young women
4. the youngest member of a group (not necessarily young);

sentences.sentence: "he remained a child in practical matters as long as he lived"

means.word_mean: 6. a project of personal concern to someone;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : probably imitative of an infant's first attempts at speech

sentences.cn: 妈妈们已被警告多年：跟新生儿一起睡是一个坏主意，因为这会增加婴儿在夜间意外死亡的风险。
sentences.en: Mothers have been warned for years that sleeping with their newborn infant is a bad idea, because it increases the risk that the baby might die unexpectedly during the night.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 如今，为了减少出现婴儿猝死综合征的风险，美国儿科学会建议妈妈不要跟宝宝睡在一张床上，而是睡在同一个房间。
sentences.en: Right now, to reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome,  the American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that mothers not sleep in the same bed as their babies, but sleep in the same room.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 你们为什么要考虑在大学选一门人口学课程呢？各位可能成长在当初婴儿潮那一代人即将退休甚至过世的时代。
sentences.en: Why should you consider taking a course in demography in college? You’ll be growing up in a generation where the baby boomers are going into retirement and dying.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 如果你用一块布盖住了一个婴儿 ( 26 )  最喜欢的玩具，这个婴儿就会认为玩具消失了，且不会再去寻找。
sentences.en: If you cover a baby ’ s 26 favorite toy with a piece of cloth, the baby thinks the toy has disappeared and stops looking for it.
sentences.from: 15年12月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 请将婴儿轻轻放下.
sentences.en: Lay the baby down gently.

sentences.cn: 消防队员从失火的房子里救出一个婴儿.
sentences.en: The fireman rescued a baby from burning house.

sentences.cn: 你是否想要自己的婴儿有一双蓝色的眼睛,一头棕色 、 金色或黑色的头发 呢 ?
sentences.en: Do you want your baby to have blue eyes or brown, blond hair or dark?

sentences.cn: 怎样把狮子从婴儿身边赶跑 呢 ?如果.
sentences.en: How could she get the lion away from her baby? If she ran.

sentences.cn: 婴儿被离弃于风雨之中.
sentences.en: The baby was left exposed to the wind and rain.

sentences.cn: 当所有婴儿潮世代出生的人都老到可以退休的时候,我们要怎麽办?
sentences.en: What will we do when all the baby boomers are old enough to retire?

sentences.cn: 迈克: 你还没买婴儿车我也许能帮上忙.
sentences.en: Mike: You haven't bought a baby carriage yet Maybe I can help.

sentences.cn: 虽然她的婴儿有病, 她还是脱身离去出席一个重要会议.
sentences.en: Though her baby was unwell, she managed to away from him to attend an important meeting.

sentences.cn: 和婴儿玩耍我只有趴在地上.
sentences.en: I had to go dawn on the floor to play with the baby.

sentences.cn: 婴儿大声吵闹地讨食.
sentences.en: The baby is clamoring to be fed.

sentences.cn: 他们用红色球代替蓝色球, 看看婴儿是否注意到了.
sentences.en: They substituted red balls for blue, to see if the baby would notice.

sentences.cn: 婴儿好奇地四处张望着.
sentences.en: The baby looked around curiously.

sentences.cn: 该公司的芯片非常灵敏,可以监测到一个新生婴儿的呼吸.
sentences.en: It is , GM claims , sensitive enough to notice the breathing of a newborn baby.

sentences.cn: 因此, 婴儿在子宫内还没有任何属于自己的细菌.
sentences.en: So, in the womb, babies don't have any bacteria to call their own.

sentences.cn: 婴儿哭得声音都嘶哑了.

sentences.cn: 婴儿平躺着, 两腿向空中踢.

sentences.en: But Senegal has a few betters incubators in which to keep premature babies warm.

sentences.en: The policewoman took good care of the throwaway baby as a temporary mother.

sentences.en: The angel Gabriel tells Mary that she will have a baby and to call him Jesus.

sentences.en: I chucked the baby under the chin and kissed it on the cheek.

sentences.cn: 婴孩必须给予很多关心和照顾.

sentences.en: Mary nursed him like a baby for a week.

sentences.cn: 这婴孩一连几个小时咿咿呀呀.

sentences.cn: 母亲是孩子的保护者.

Sentence.sentence: After graduating with a degree in business and accounting, she joined a public accounting firm, married, bought a house, put lots of stuff in it, and had a baby.

Sentence.sentence: She loved finding out people were getting married, having babies and traveling.

Sentence.sentence: Some tables will arrive on a Sunday, order a whole chicken and a shoulder of lamb or a baby pig, and just stay for hours enjoying everything we bring out for them.

Sentence.sentence: I've heard that at a factory in the area two pregnant women who were working with paint requested a transfer to a safer department, because they wanted to prevent damage to their unborn babies.

Sentence.sentence: They quit work to protect their unborn babies
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He has discovered it – babies don't even know that language exists – and he has found out how it works and learnt to use it appropriately.
